Jeff:

Given your timescale, one option is simply to go browse the bookstor=
e
near you & buy
an intro NN text you feel most suits your style. If you ha=
ve more
time, list a few first
& cross check on the web before buying.

Any=
way, for my 10 cents:

http://www.shef.ac.uk/psychology/gurney/notes/

The =
above was developed into a regular book 'an introduction to neural
networks=
'
which is a good quick run-thru (214pp) where the author tries to use
mini=
mal math.

These other websites I bookmarked as interesting but can't vouch=
 for
them personally:

http://www.willamette.edu/~gorr/classes/cs449/intro.=
html
http://www.dontveter.com/bpr/bpr.html
http://www.alphabit.co.uk/AI/AID=
ocs1.aspx
http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/library/l-neural/

Also goo=
d (but with more math) is 'neural smithing' by Russell D Reed
& Robert J Ma=
rks
with a short chapter on GAs.

Hope thats some help

Mike
